definition: the spirit or character of a political party
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The principle of Party property is the fundamental principle of jural news.
sentences.chinese: 黨性原則是法制新聞的基本原則。

sentences.english: Leading officials' style of work is essentially the question of Party spirit.
sentences.chinese: 領導幹部作風問題，說到底是黨性問題。

sentences.english: In order to achieve stability and unity, we must eliminate factionalism and enhance Party spirit.
sentences.chinese: 要安定團結，就必須消除派性，增強黨性。

sentences.english: Strengthening mastery of party spirit is a good tradition of reinforcing self-construction of our party.
sentences.chinese: 加強黨性修養是我們黨強化自身建設的優良傳統。

sentences.english: The essence of Lenin's "indoctrination theory" is the formation of the "indoctrination" party spirit view.
sentences.chinese: 列寧“灌輸”理論的精髓在於形成了“灌輸”黨性觀。

definition: (of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
to respect the wise and venerate the worthy (idiom); to honor the great and the good
lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect
pinyin: qian1 yi1 fa4 er2 dong4 quan2 shen1

definition: to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
a project of vital and lasting importance
